definition: Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Liu
deep pool/deep/profound
Fu Jian (338-385), emperor of Former Qin 前秦[Qian2 Qin2], reigning from 357-385
Shi Le, founder of Later Zhao of the Sixteen Kingdoms 後趙|后赵 (319-350)
Former Yan of the Sixteen Kingdoms (337-370)
Sima Yan (236-290), founding emperor of Jin dynasty 晋 after the Three Kingdoms period, reigned 265-290 as Emperor Wu of Jin 晉武帝
Later Yan of the Sixteen Kingdoms (384-409)
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
Former Zhao of the Sixteen Kingdoms (304-329)
Former Qin of the Sixteen Kingdoms (351-395)
Later Han or Eastern Han dynasty (25-220)/Later Han of the Five Dynasties (947-950)
Li Yuan, personal name of first Tang emperor Gaozu 唐高祖[Tang2 Gao1 zu3] (566-635), reigned 618-626
Later Qin of the Sixteen Kingdoms (384-417)
Cao Wei, the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms, established as a dynasty in 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕, son of Cao Cao, replaced by Jin dynasty in 265
Wang Dun (266-324), powerful general of Jin dynasty and brother of civil official Wang Dao 王導|王导, subsequently rebellious warlord 322-324
Wuhuan (nomadic tribe)
Emperor Xian of Han (181-234), the final Han emperor, set up by Dong Zhuo 董卓, reigned 189-220, forced to abdicate 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕
Eastern Wei of the Northern dynasties (534-550), formed from the break-up of Wei of the Northern Dynasties 北魏
